text: Fill in the blank with the correct words: One should __________ one's studies with utmost seriousness.
Choose the correct option to complete the sentence. I am indebted to my friend's wise ______________.
Choose the word that best replaces the italicized words in the given sentence- In earlier times, rebels were executed for killing the king.
Choose the word which is nearest in meaning to 'Vicarious'.
Choose the correct option to frame a question from the following sentence, using the appropriate punctuation- I asked him why he wasn't in class.
option1: I asked him-'Why you not in class?'
option2: I asked him, 'Why you are not in class?'
option3: I asked him: 'Why you are not in class?'
option4: I asked him, 'Why are you not in class?'
correctAnswer: I asked him, 'Why are you not in class?'

text: Identify the incorrect pair
Select the idiom that best replaces the words in italics in the following sentence- You should review your options carefully before you make a decision.
option1: make hay while the sun shines

text: Fill in the blanks with the appropriate group of words. He has __________ meticulous in _______ the project, ___________ rise to ______ irregularities.
Select the correct proverb to fill in the blank in the following sentence: It is best not to delay since _____________.
option2: a stitch in time saves nine
option3: a bad workman blames his tools
option4: all's fair in love and war
correctAnswer: a stitch in time saves nine

text: Read the following sentences and then select the correct option. (i) One should not interfere in the personal affairs of others. (ii) The personal in that company are dissatisfied with their salaries.

Choose the word that can correctly replace both the italicized words in the following sentences. Sentence (i) - I appreciate his exuberant nature. Sentence (ii) - Everyone at the party was in a festive mood.
Identify the mood in the following sentence - I would surely go there if I could.
Choose the option that correctly changes the following sentence into indirect speech- He said, 'I will go there tomorrow.'
option1: He said that I will go there tomorrow.
option2: He told that he shall go there tomorrow.
option3: He said that he will go there after today.
option4: He said that he would go there the next day.
correctAnswer: He said that he would go there the next day.

text: Who is a 'psephologist'?
option1: Someone who specializes in statistical studies of voting patterns in elections.
option2: Someone who specializes in a certain branch of neuropsychology.
option3: Someone who specializes in a certain branch of astrophysics.
correctAnswer: Someone who specializes in statistical studies of voting patterns in elections.

text: Pick out the word that is not similar to the others.
What kind of a person is a 'Clairvoyant'?
Correctly change the following sentence to the active voice, using the appropriate punctuation - My daughter expressed her preference for History over English.
option1: My daughter says 'I prefer History over English.'
option2: My daughter said, 'I prefer History over English.'
option3: My daughter tells - 'I prefer History over English.'
option4: My daughter told, 'I prefer History over English.'
correctAnswer: My daughter said, 'I prefer History over English.'
